instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00138: Not recognizing keyboard
threads.message:
Have a board that doesnt recognize any keyboard, except external. Trackpad confirmed good. Tested on multiple frames with same results. Cap lock light doesn't come on either. Voltage on cap lock pin "WS_KBD15_CAP" is 2.4v. Since all keys aren't responding, is there a common items between both. 
PP3V3_S4 is also present

threads.title: 820-00138: Not recognizing keyboard
threads.message:
Manual SMC reset key combination works?

Inspect U4820/30 area.
Check for activity on I2C_IOXP_SCL/SDA lines when pressing any key.

threads.title: 820-00138: Not recognizing keyboard
threads.message:
SMC reset works.

Regarding  I2C_IOXP_SCL/SDA, Would you have a correct boardview for this board. The one i have isn't quiet correct and i've not been able to find the true board view. Or any suggestion on what probe points to use

threads.title: 820-00138: Not recognizing keyboard
threads.message:
No real boardview available for this board.
You can compare the U5820/30 area with 00163.
The surrounding resistors should be placed in similar postion.

threads.title: 820-00138: Not recognizing keyboard
threads.message: So, measured around and found IOXP2_INT_L. Diode mode reading was 1.38. On another similar board, though dead, had measurement of 0.68. Confirmed on 2 of my donor boards with the same 0.68 reading. I check the surrounding pins on J4801. Unless you think of something else, i'm going to order and replace U4830.

threads.title: 820-00138: Not recognizing keyboard
threads.message:
Probably bad solder because of corrosion.
Remove the chip, put leaded solder on the board pads and resolder it.
Or directly change it with one from donor board.

threads.title: 820-00138: Not recognizing keyboard
threads.message:
Replaced U4830. Now fixed. 
Thanks for the support as always.
